content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
─────────────────────
### Copper Cable Factory at (2.5, 17.5)
Consists of the following entities:
• Factory Burner Inserter at (2.5, 16.5) – Identified as the “new factory burner inserter” retrieved in Step 210.
• Dedicated Burner Inserter at (3.5, 17.5) – Placed at the copper cable factory interface (its drop position is (4.5, 17.5)).
• Cable Factory Input Chest at (2.5, 17.5) – Serves as the interface’s storage.
• Assembling Machine at (1.5, 19.5) – Connected to the interface for further processing.

### Belt Depot at (3.5, 15.5)
Consists of the following entities:
• Wooden Chest at (3.5, 15.5) – Crafted and placed to serve as an isolated belt depot.
• Transport Belt Segment at (4.5, 15.5) – Positioned adjacent to the depot chest to form the belt connection.
• Depot Burner Inserter at (3.5, 14.5) – Placed adjacent to the chest (with a pickup at (3.5, 15.5) and drop position at (3.5, 13.5)) to receive items via the multi‐segment belt.

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• Transport Belt Connection Issues  
  Repeated errors indicate that transport belts must not be connected directly to a Prototype.SteamEngine target. Always attach an inserter that feeds items into the steam engine and use that inserter as the connection target.

• Entity Placement Range Error  
  Placement failures (e.g. “target position … too far” with a reported distance of 15.89 versus a 10‐unit maximum) require moving the player closer to the target position before attempting placement.

• Undefined Reference Error  
  A NameError (e.g. reference to “target_chest” not defined) occurred due to using an incorrect or undefined variable name. Ensure that the variable for the target entity is correctly defined and referenced.

• Inventory Shortage Error  
  Errors reporting missing items (such as “No wooden_chest in inventory”) highlight that required items must be present in inventory prior to placement. Verify inventory availability before executing placement commands.
